channel.title: Is this possible?
channel.description:
Lets say I'm on some other forums that allow pictures in their siggy's. No, not R-S. Now, I'm calling this picture from another site, obviously. http://mysite.com/images/1.png Right? Now, is it possible to have some JS and/or PHP to make that image 'rotate' at random. No, I don't mean literally rotate the image. I mean, I have an index of lets say 15 images. All with literal names: http://mysite.com/images/lib/image1.png - http://mysite.com/images/lib/image15.png and somewhere else on that site there's a file that would call a method that each time 1.png is loaded, it would be a different one from the images lib. Is that possible?
If an example or something is needed, I'll try. Obviously the example won't be a working thing, as I don't know how to. Maybe it'll be done in Adobe flash or some shit.

item.title: Is this possible?

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well I found something else that’s wrong…

^Here’s the script in action.

The only time the image itself changes is when I manually refresh the page.

Edit: Never mind, it’s working now.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

sk8rdude461:

There all named 1-7 yes, and they are all the same size (Different images than the ones I was testing here).

If they’re all the same size you can force the dimensions…

$width = X;
$height = Y;

…or resize them all to the 200x200 that you wanted in any image editor and not worry about it

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Sweet, thanks a lot Justin 

<?php
$img = rand(1, 7);

header('Content-type: image/jpeg');

$im = imagecreatefromjpeg('imgs/' . $img . '.jpg');
list($width, $height) = getimagesize('imgs/' . $img . '.jpg');
$newimg = imagecreatetruecolor(200, 200);
imagecopyresampled($newimg, $im, 0, 0, 0, 0, 200, 200, $width, $height);
imagejpeg($newimg);
imagejpeg($im);
imagedestroy($newimg);
imagedestroy($im);
?>

Read full topic

imagedestroy($im);[/code]

$newimg = imagecreatetruecolor(200, 200); imagecopyresampled($newimg, $im, 0, 0, 0, 0, 200, 200, $width, $height); imagejpeg($newimg); imagedestroy($newimg); imagedestroy($im);

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’d rather just set it directly instead of setting a path to it.

<?php
$img = rand(1, 7);

header('Content-type: image/jpeg');

$im = imagecreatefromjpeg('imgs/' . $img . '.jpg');
imagejpeg($im);
imagedestroy($im);
?>

How would I set the image size to say 200x200?

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

justin’s is getting the images from the same directory the php file is in.

you can supply it a path here,

[code]<?php
$img = rand(1, 3);
$path = “/images/”;

header(‘Content-type: image/jpeg’);

$im = imagecreatefromjpeg($path . $img . ‘.jpg’);
imagejpeg($im);
imagedestroy($im);
?>[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

you have to supply the content type in the header as an image and use imagepng

[code]<?php
function getImagesFromDir($path) {
$images = array();
if ($img_dir = @opendir($path)) {
while (false !== ($img_file = readdir($img_dir))) {
if (preg_match("/(.gif|.jpg|.png)$/", $img_file)) {
$images[] = $img_file;
}
}
closedir($img_dir);
}
return $images;
}

function getRandomFromArray($ar) {
    mt_srand((double)microtime() * 1000000 );
    $num = array_rand($ar);
    return $ar[$num];
}

$path = 'imgs';

$imgList = getImagesFromDir($path);
$img = getRandomFromArray($imgList);

$im = imagecreatefrompng($path . "/" . $img);

if($im) {
    header('Content-Type: image/png');
    imagepng($im);
    imagedestroy($im);
}

?>[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:12, topic:519012”]I imagine you want a random signature generator so each time a user refreshes the page you get a randomly-selected avatar. Correct? If so, follow the instructions above about choosing a random image out of a selection that you have and set the Content-Type header to image/png while outputting the image file. This causes the browser to look for an image as opposed to a webpage.

The only thing that I imagine being a problem is if the forum software sanitizes their URL and doesn’t accept having .php at the end of the path… Of course that can be fixed.[/quote]
I’ve got a php file outputtigng randomized images into another php file (It can be done in 1, but I made it in 2 because I thought maybe that’d help).

Edit:

So here’s the entire script:

<?php
function getImagesFromDir($path) {
    $images = array();
    if ( $img_dir = @opendir($path) ) {
        while ( false !== ($img_file = readdir($img_dir)) ) {
            // checks for gif, jpg, png
            if ( preg_match("/(\.gif|\.jpg|\.png)$/", $img_file) ) {
                $images[] = $img_file;
            }
        }
        closedir($img_dir);
    }
    return $images;
}

function getRandomFromArray($ar) {
    mt_srand( (double)microtime() * 1000000 ); // php 4.2+ not needed
    $num = array_rand($ar);
    return $ar[$num];
}

$root = '';

$path = 'imgs/';

$imgList = getImagesFromDir($root . $path);
$img = getRandomFromArray($imgList);
?>

and the html under that:

<html>
	<head>
		<meta name="Content-Type" content="image/jpeg">
	</head>
	<body>
		<img src="<?php echo $path . $img ?>" alt="" width="200px" height="200px"/>
	</body>
</html>

Read full topic

item.title: Is this possible?
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

I imagine you want a random signature generator so each time a user refreshes the page you get a randomly-selected avatar. Correct? If so, follow the instructions above about choosing a random image out of a selection that you have and set the Content-Type header to image/png while outputting the image file. This causes the browser to look for an image as opposed to a webpage.

The only thing that I imagine being a problem is if the forum software sanitizes their URL and doesn’t accept having .php at the end of the path… Of course that can be fixed.

Read full topic

Okay here guys:

Free Web Hosting

Free Web Hosting - Your Website need to be migrated

Absolutely Free Web Hosting with PHP, MySQL, cPanel and no Ads!


Click on that and hit the reload button, it’s made in Flash, lolol.
Also, some times it breaks. I don’t know why. But what ever.
[/quote]
Vain’s suggestion would work for that yep, just use PHP rand to generate a number between a range, then use that number as an index to pick from a predefined array of images.[/quote]
But then wouldn’t you need to refresh the page?

@sk8rdude461
Stat Signatures are also php but they are allowed (because the url is .png ?), it’s being done with htacces rewrite.
Many forums fall for it.
